title: Elliott Management to Sell Stake in Hong Kong Bank, Ending Activist Campaign
sub_head: A deal, if concluded, would follow years of tense relations and a long slide in Bank of East Asiaâ€™s stock price
body:
One of the longest-running shareholder activism battles in Asia is coming to an end.
Bank of East Asia Ltd. , a Hong Kong-based lender, said Friday it intends to pay up to the equivalent of about $373 million to purchase all the shares held by U.S. activist hedge fund Elliott Management Corp. in an off-market transaction.
